material.mattext: Which of the following statements is true?
The data provide moderately weak evidence of a fairly strong linear relationship between cry count (a few days after birth) and IQ (at age 3) among infants.
The data provide fairly strong evidence of a fairly strong linear relationship between cry count (a few days after birth) and IQ (at age 3) among infants.
The data provide moderately weak evidence of a moderately weak linear relationship between cry count (a few days after birth) and IQ (at age 3) among infants.
The data provide fairly strong evidence of a moderately weak linear relationship between cry count (a few days after birth) and IQ (at age 3) among infants.

Incorrect. Recall that r measures the strength of the linear relationship in our data (where the closer r is to -1 or 1, the stronger the linear relationship). The p-value of the test measures the strength of the evidence provided by the data that what was observed can be generalized to the relevant population (where the smaller the p-value, the stronger the evidence).

Incorrect. It is true that the small p-value (0.012) indicates that the data provide fairly strong evidence that what we observed can be generalized to the relevant population. However, recall that r measures the strength of the linear relationship in our data (where the closer it is to -1 or 1, the stronger the linear relationship).

Incorrect. It is true that r=0.4 indicates that there a moderately weak linear relationship in our data. However, recall that the p-value of the test measures the strength of the evidence provided by the data that what we observed can be generalized to the relevant population (where the smaller the p-value, the stronger the evidence).

Good Job! Indeed, r = 0.4 indicates that there is a moderately weak linear relationship between cry count and IQ in our data. In addition, the small p-value (0.012) tell us that this data provide fairly strong evidence that this linear relationship can be generalized to infants in general.
